label.text:
Largest Omnivores
Whale sharks are omnivores that live in the coastal waters of tropical and warm temperate seas.
They are the largest shark species and so are classified as fish. They are given the name ‘whale’ because of their size.
These sharks feed by filtering seawater to capture food.
Until recently, they were thought to only eat plankton (microscopic plants and animals), krill (small, shrimp-like crustaceans) and larger animals such as squid and small fish.
However, a recent study has found that whale sharks also eat large amounts of macroalgae (large seaweeds).‌Whale sharks in the Bohol Sea, Philippines
